Table1.News title: Free COVID-19 vaccinations coming to long-term care facilities
Table1.News content: Residents and staff in nursing homes and long-term care settings in California will receive the Pfizer vaccine at no cost through a federal partnership administered by Walgreens and CVS.

California has announced a package of assistance for small businesses impacted by COVID-19, including $500 million in grants. Grant applications will be accepted December 30, 2020, through January 8, 2021.

Table1.News content: To preserve our health care system, the Regional Stay Home Order goes into effect if intensive care unit (ICU) capacity drops below 15% in a region. Counties in the region will be subject to new restrictions.
